New Records: Rohit Sharma broke the 40-year-old record for the fastest century by an India player at a Cricket World Cup, reaching his hundred in 63 balls
Rohit Sharma became the joint-fastest batter to reach 1000 Cricket World Cup runs, doing so in just 19 innings
Rohit Sharma is the only Cricket World Cup 2023 captain to score a century to this point of the tournament
Rohit Sharma overtook Ricky Ponting in third place in the total ODI century list with his 31st ODI hundred
Rohit Sharma became the batter with most international sixes across all formats, passing Chris Gayle with 556 sixes
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli (55*) and Shreyas Iyer (25*) finished the chase
Rashid Khan (2/57 off eight overs) was the only bowler to make any headway for Afghanistan
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit claimed unanimous Player of the Match honours, as India joined New Zealand and Pakistan as teams to start two from two at the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rohit's century was set up by the opening partnership of Rohit and Ishan Kishan (47), who put on 156 in 18.4 overs
Jasprit Bumrah produced his best CWC figures
